meanings.definition: To strike or hit more times than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: In the game, the batter was able to outhit the pitcher with ease.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player managed to outhit his opponent in every at-bat.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outhit the mouse in a playful game of tag.
meanings.sent4: She outhit her personal record, swinging the bat with determination.
meanings.sent5: The student practiced diligently to outhit all her classmates in the spelling bee.

meanings.sent1: The skilled boxer was able to outhit his opponent in every round.
meanings.sent2: The team captain always strives to outhit his own performance from the previous game.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to outhit his own cooking skills by experimenting with new recipes.
meanings.sent4: The artist managed to outhit her previous masterpiece with a stunning new painting.
meanings.sent5: The musician practiced tirelessly to outhit all other performers in the upcoming concert.
